owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water evaporated into the atmosphere from reservoirs.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Reservoir Evaporation-UT
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water evaporated into the atmosphere from reservoirs.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Reservoir Surface Area
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Determine the average water surface area in acres for each month from a curve or equation that correlates gage height or content with surface area. Area-gage height or area-capacity data can be obtained from the agencies mentioned in Step 1.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Reservoir Targets
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Target (im) = Current Storage (im) - (Current Storage (im) - Forecast (im) - End Target) / (Months Remaining +1)
The reservoir target file contains monthly targets for a reservoir's minimum and maximum contents.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Return Flow-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of applied water that is not consumptively used and flows to the surface water system. It includes treated wastewater discharges to the surface water system.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Riparian Consumption-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water lost due to ET in the riparian zone

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Riparian Depletions-UT
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water transpired from plants and evaporated along the riparian zone

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: River Evaporation-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water evaporated from rivers into the atmosphere

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:isDefinedBy: Not sure if River inflow and Basin Inflow are exactly the same
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: River Inflow-UT
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water entering through rivers from an upstream subarea.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: River Use By Wet Pasture-UT
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The volume of river water calculated to be used by wet pastures

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Runoff-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Runoff from landscape to the region's surface water due to rainfall or irrigation

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Runoff-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water flowing into the surface water system within a water budget zone from precipitation over the land surface.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Runoff-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Runoff consists of water that goes from precipitation in a given MBAU into the surface water system in the same MBAU without moving through the groundwater system. Inflows from upstream MBAUs are counted as surface water inflows and not runoff

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: SCS TR21
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Re = (0.7091*Rt0.82416 – 0.11556)*(10(0.02426*cu) )*F - Re - monthly effective precipitation - Rt - total monthly precipitation - cu - monthly consumptive use (potential ET) - F - function of D - D - the net depth of application - F = 0.531747 + 0.295164(D) – 0.057697(D2 ) + 0.003804(D3 )

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: STATSGO Soils Data
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: Soil moisture capacity from crops and STATSGO soils data

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Self-Supplied Domestic-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The Self-Supplied Domestic category includes self-supplied residences that may be single family or multi-family dwellings with well permits issued by the NMOSE under 72-12-1.1 NMSA 1978. This category includes water used for domestic purposes as defined under 19.27.5.7.F New Mexico Administrative Code (NMAC).
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: 0% of self supplied domestic is metered

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Self Supplied Domestic Population
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The self-supplied domestic population in a county is determined by subtracting the population served by PWSs from the total population in that county. When a county has two or more river basins, the total county population must be calculated by its basin components. The distribution of the population in each county by river basin is based upon ratios derived from 1990 census block and tract data that were overlaid with hydrologic cataloging units. The population served by PWSs in each basin is then subtracted from the total population of the respective basins to yield the self-supplied domestic population.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Snotel Network of Weather Stations
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Managed by the National Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) in the high elevation mountains surrounding the Green River basin. Climate data, along with maps and summary reports from these climate stations, are available online (http://www.wcc.nrcs.usda.gov/snow/).

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: State Agricultural Statistics
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: Source: CU and Losses Report 2001-2005 (Word Doc)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: State CU
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Publically available model developed by State of Colorado)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Stored Water Export-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of groundwater pumped (extracted) from the underlying aquifer(s) through a defined recharge and extraction program for use outside the water budget zone. For example, a water bank with dedicated extraction wells can provide data for stored water export. It does not include stored water extraction, groundwater extraction, and groundwater export. Groundwater export and stored water export will be combined if stored water export amounts are unknown or are not separately measured. In such a case, the total volume of combined exports will be reported as groundwater export.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Stored Water Extraction-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of groundwater pumped (extracted) from the underlying aquifer(s) through a defined recharge and extraction program for use within the water budget zone. For example, a water bank with dedicated extraction wells can provide data for stored water extraction. It does not include stored water export, groundwater extraction, and groundwater export. Groundwater extraction and stored water extraction will be combined if stored water extraction amounts are unknown or are not separately measured. In such a case, the total volume of combined extractions will be reported as groundwater extraction.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Stream Evaporation-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water evaporated into the atmosphere from streams.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Stream Gain from Groundwater-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water entering rivers and streams from the groundwater system.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Stream Inflow-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water entering through streams at the periphery of a water budget zone.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Stream Loss to Groundwater-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water entering the groundwater system from rivers and streams.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Stream Outflow-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water leaving through streams at the periphery of a water budget zone.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Streamflow
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The streamflow file may contain total baseflows or gains for each month of the simulation period. The control variable iopflo identifies which is expected; total baseflow (1) or gains (2).

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Subsurface Inflow-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water entering as groundwater into a water budget zone through its subsurface boundaries.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Subsurface Outflow-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water leaving as groundwater from a water budget zone through its subsurface boundaries.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Supply Source
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Including name or unique identifier of the water permit or water right, diversion structure, well, or reservoir

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Supply Type
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: surface water, ground water, reservoir releases, or multiple sources

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Diversion to Cropland-UT
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: All land area diversions other than groundwater

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Delivery-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of surface water delivered to a water budget zone. This does not equal the volume of surface water diversion and imported water because the latter also include conveyance seepage and evaporation during transport of the water.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Diversions-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water taken from the surface water system within a water budget zone for use within the zone.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Diversions-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water diverted from surface water to human storage and distribution systems

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Evaporation-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water evaporation is calculated by multiplying river area by Hargreaves reference ET and an open water coefficient for the respective basin. In addition to the physically based estimate of river channel evaporation described above, the surface water evaporation term also includes the portion of surface water return flows that do not end up back in a gaged stream.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Exports-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water diverted from the surface water system within a water budget zone for use outside the zone.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Flows-UT
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of surface water flowing between different bodies of water within the budget zone

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Groundwater Interactions-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Groundwater and surface water interactions are determined as the closure term in surface water system. The groundwater-surface water interaction term is equal to the sum of surface water inflows minus the sum of surface water outflows.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Inflows-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of physical inflows to surface water during the reporting period from outside the region or from other stores

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Inflows-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: As used in the NMDSWB, surface water inflows into a given MBAUconsist of flows which cross its boundary.Thus, MBAUs that occur at the headwaters of the river (for example the Pecos and Central Closed River Basins) do not have any surface water inflows.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Outflows-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of physical outflows from surface water during the reporting period to outside the region or to other stores.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Outflows-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water outflows are estimated based on USGS stream gage data as available. When a stream gage is available near the downstream border of a WPR, NMISC river basin, or County boundary it is used to represent the outflow.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Returns-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water returned to surface water from human storage and distribution systems

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Surface Water Stock-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The surface waterstock representsthe total amount ofwater in rivers and other natural water ways at any time.For the purposes of this mass balance we assume that any water in the surface water system can be diverted or impounded for human use. Available Water comes from stream flows across the boundaries of the mass balance accounting unit (MBAU) in question (State, County, or Water Planning Region), or runoff to streams and rivers from rainfall or groundwater discharge within the MBAU.Because the volume of water in surface water channels is relatively constant with respect to the state’s total water inventory, the actual storage of water in this stock will not be calculated, and storagechange through timewill be ignored.As a result of this simplifying assumptions, thefluxes into and out of this stock will be balancedat each timestep

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Total Land Return Flow-UT
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Total return flow from each land area

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Tributary Inflow-UT
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Water that flows into major rivers in the budget zone from tributaries.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: US Bureau of Reclamation AgriMet Stations
USGS Estimates of Basin Groundwater Flows

owl:NamedIndividual.dc:source: UT_1-Water-Budget-Process
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: USGS Groundwater Reports
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Groundwater use from USGS groundwater reports allocated annual to each water budget study area from 1989 to 2009. Water Rights irrigation wells were used to proportion water from USGS groundwater use areas to water budget study areas. USGS groundwater use areas were modified to spatially account for where their study wells were actually located in association with irrigated agriculture.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: USGS StreamStats
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: For estimating inflow in ungaged basins

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: USU Research Report 145
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: Blainey-Criddle crop coefficients from USU Research Report 145

owl:NamedIndividual.dc:source: Assessing Agricultural Consumptive Use in the Upper Colorado River Basin
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: UT Diversion Records from River Commissioners
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The Utah Division of Water Rights (UDWR) regulates the appropriation and distribution of water in the State of Utah. Some basins maintain surface water diversion records using automated recorders and field readings. Commissioners responsible for maintaining diversion records are hired by the State Engineer; however assigned commissioners are requested by, and funded by, the water users in each subbasin. For basins with commissioners, it often takes 2 to 3 years for collected diversion records to be provided to the State. In general, few diversions are recorded in the Green River and Colorado River basins in Utah.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: UT Division of Water Resources Area-Altitude Method
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: For estimating inflow in ungaged basins
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: For flows estimated from either StreamStats or the Area-Altitude Method, monthly flows are calculated as a proportion of the flow of a base station.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: UT Effective Precipitation Method
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: UT estimates effective precipitation to be 80% of total precipitation during the irrigation season

owl:NamedIndividual.dc:source: Assessing Agricultural Consumptive Use in the Upper Colorado River Basin
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: UT Irrigated Acreage Assessment
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Irrigated acreage assessments define the amount of acreage that was actively irrigated and cultivated in any given year. Irrigated acreage assessments can range in the level of attribution;
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: Each 5-year assessment includes field-verified estimates of acreage, crop type, and irrigation method. Water source (i.e. specific irrigating ditch) is not identified. Upon completion, data is filed in the State Geographic Information Database (SGID) and maintained by the State Automated Geographic Reference Center (AGRC). Once the data has been published on the AGRC website (http://gis.utah.gov/data/water-data-services/), the data becomes available to the public and is ready to be use in preparing water-related planning studies.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: UT Municipal Potable and Secondary Diversion Records
UT Reservoir Storage and Release Records
Ungaged Stream Gains-WY
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Stream gain from groundwater

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Ungaged Surface Water Inflow-CO
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water entering through suface waters at the periphery of a water budget zone that is not measured by gages.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Urban Water System Inflows-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of physical inflows to the urban water system during the reporting period; from outside the region or from other stores

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Urban Water System Outflows-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Outflows from the urban water system; to outside the region or to other stores. For example the discharge of treated wastewater to a river or to the sea.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: WY Agriculture Consumptive Use Estimation Method
WY Diversion Data from Water Users

owl:NamedIndividual.dc:source: Assessing Agricultural Consumptive Use in the Upper Colorado River Basin
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: WY Diversion Records
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Major diversions and diversions on regulated tributaries recorded, ~150 continuously recorded, ~600 spot measured. Data available ~6 months after irrigation season. The State Engineer’s Office Board of Control Division is responsible for the administration and regulation of the waters of the state based on the Prior Appropriation System. The Division IV Superintendent, Hydrographers, and Water Commissioners are responsible for administering the water rights and permits in the Green River Basin and taking measurements of streamflow and diversions in their basin. The responsibility of recording diversions extends to both surface and ground water use, however there is very little ground water used for irrigation in the Green River Basin, therefore this discussion will focus on surface water diversions.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: WY Electrical Generation Method
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The Green River Basin Plan reports consumptive electrical water use but does not state diversion/pumping or return flow rates. The Northeast River Basin reports average annual diversion/pumping volumes and return flows. From this data, Wenck determined consumptive water use for use in this index. The Platte River Basin Plan reports consumptive electrical water use. Electrical generation data were downloaded from the United States Energy Information Administration (USEIA) webpage25 for coal and natural gas fueled electrical generation facilities. The USEIA electrical generation dataset is updated monthly.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: WY Industrial Production Method
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Production data were downloaded from the WYOGCC data portal30 and compiled into annual production. This index assumes that a linear relationship exists between the volume produced and the net volume of water required. Therefore, the portion of industrial water use attributed to each sector is correlated to the produced volume.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: WY Irrigated Acreage Consumptive Use Model
WY Mine Production Method
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Annual employee hours and coal production data were downloaded from the Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) web portal27. The MSHA is part of the United States Department of Labor. The MSHA publishes employee hours worked for all mine types and production quantities at coal mines data each quarter for all mines where the average quarterly employment is greater than zero.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: WY Office of the State Engineer
WY Office of the State Engineer Hydrographer Commissioner Reports
Wastewater Collected-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Discharge of wastewater into the region's wastewater collection system. It includes discharge of wastewater by users into wastewater collection systems. It excludes wastewater collected by urban utilities outside the region and then transferred into the region

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Water Release Caused by Land Subsidence-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of water released to an aquifer on a one-time basis as a result of land subsidence, which is caused by the inelastic consolidation of porous fine-grained material.
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:prefLabel: Water Release Caused by Land Subsidence

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Water Resources irrigated land use database
Water Supply
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: Water supply data is based on diversion records and streamflow data

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Water Use-NM
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Water use is presented as withdrawals, depletions, and returns. Withdrawals are defined as the total amount of water taken from a source to be used elsewhere, depletions are defined as the quantity of water consumed, i.e. evaporated and no longer available for use elsewhere. Return flows are difference between withdrawals and depletions. The data is provided for each river basin and each county.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Winter Ice Surface Area
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Winter evaporation estimates must take into account the possible effects of ice cover. Partial ice cover will inhibit evaporation; complete ice cover will reduce water surface evaporation to zero. Thus, the average surface area computed in Step 2 must be adjusted to reflect the surface area covered by ice. For large reservoirs, daily measurements of ice cover may be available. Some agencies have developed tables showing the percentage of ice cover by month, based on historical records, which may be used when no other data are available.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Withdrawal Method
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: W = (POP)(GPCD)/892.74 (NM)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Wyoming Water Resources Data Systems Water and Climate Map Server
Allocated Diversion: Environmental Purposes-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water diverted under a recognised commitment to deliver surface water for environmental purposes.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Diversion: Individual Users-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water diverted to users other than the urban water system, under water access entitlements for which an allocation has been recognised (see line item 32.3 – surface water access entitlement for allocated diversions). It includes allocated diversions for:• private users and irrigation schemes where those are not identified as a water asset of the water accounting region• allocation holders located outside the region's boundary.It excludes allocated diversions for: irrigation schemes where those are identified as a water asset of the water accounting region (reported in line item 17.13 – entitled diversion of allocated surface water to irrigation scheme).

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Diversion: Inter-region-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water diverted outside of the region, under water access entitlements for which an allocation has been recognised

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Diversion: Irrigation-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Diversion of surface water to the region's irrigation scheme to service a prior allocation announced on behalf of the irrigation scheme. It includes diversions under 32.3 Surface water access entitlement for allocation diversion.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Diversion: Irrigation Scheme-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Diversion of surface water to the region's irrigation scheme to service a prior allocation announced on behalf of the irrigation scheme. It includes diversions under 32.3 Surface water access entitlement for allocation diversion

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Diversion: Urban System-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water diverted to urban water system, under water access entitlements for which an allocation has been recognised (see account 2012-2017 line item 32.3 – surface water access entitlement for allocation diversion). It includes allocated diversions for: allocation holders located outside the region's boundary.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Diversions:Surface Water-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Diversion of surface water to the region's urban water system and irrigation scheme to service a prior allocation announced on behalf of the urban water system. It includes diversions under 32.3 Surface water access entitlement for allocation diversion.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Extraction: Environmental Purposes-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Groundwater extracted for environmental purposes, under water access entitlements for which an allocation has been recognised

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Extraction: Groundwater-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Diversion of groundwater to the region's urban water system to service a prior allocation announced on behalf of the urban water system. It includes diversions under 33.3 Groundwater access entitlement for allocation diversion.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Extraction: Individual Users-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Groundwater extracted to users other than the urban water system, under water access entitlements for which an allocation has been recognised (see line item 33.3 Groundwater access entitlement for allocation extraction). It includes allocated extractions for: • private users and irrigation schemes where those are not identified as a water asset of the water accounting region• allocation holders located outside the region's boundary.It excludes allocated extractions for:• irrigation schemes where those are identified as a water asset of the water accounting region (reported in line item 18.13 Groundwater allocation diversion - irrigation scheme).

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Extraction: Irrigation-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Diversion of groundwater to the external irrigation scheme to service a prior allocation announced on behalf of the irrigation scheme.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocated Extraction: Urban System-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Diversion of groundwater to the region's urban water system to service a prior allocation announced on behalf of the urban water system. It includes diversions under 33.3 Groundwater access entitlement for allocation diversion.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Allocation Extraction: Salinity and Water Table Management-AUS
Applied Water Reuse/Recycled Water-CA
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Volume of applied water contributing to (1) lateral flow below the land surface that is influenced by impermeable layers and re-emerges as return flow for reuse in the land system, (2) tailwater available for reuse in the land system, or (3) a combination of both.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Brown and Caldwell,1984
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: For the purpose of estimating withdrawals for the self-supplied domestic population, in most counties, an area-wide average of 80 GPCD was used. This GPCD value was selected based upon research completed by Brown and Caldwell (1984),

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Climate Coefficient (kt)
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Climatic coefficients that are directly related to the mean air temperature for each of the consecutive short periods which constitutes the growing season
The climatic coefficient (kt) equals 0.0173t-0.314

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Commercial: Golf Courses-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Many golf course water supply systems in the state are metered and report their annual diversions to NMOSE. For the self-supplied courses that are not metered, withdrawals are estimated using the procedure outlined in Chapter 3, Irrigated Agriculture.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Commercial: Incomplete Metered-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: While most self-supplied facilities are required to be metered and to report their annual water use, many do not. When metered records for the water-use inventory year are incomplete, water use is estimated based on earlier records (as with other categories in this Report) or prorated based on similar operations.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Commercial: Metered-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Some facilities in the Self-Supplied Commercial, Industrial, Mining, and Power categories report their metered diversions to NMOSE, and those reports are identified in agency databases or through district office communications. NMOSE agency databases identify withdrawals by use, which are then used to separate the metered withdrawal categories in this chapter.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Commercial: Schools-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Water withdrawals for K-12 schools that are not metered, but are self supplied as identified by NMED, are computed by multiplying the student population by a per capita water requirement.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Commercial: Unmetered-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Some facilities are unmetered, and these can be difficult to identify if a declaration has never been filed with the NMOSE. Consequently, many of these facilities are not captured in the water use inventory. When possible, these entities are identified through directories maintained by various business associations and/or regulatory agencies. The executive director or operator is then contacted by phone or mail to obtain an estimate of water use.

owl:NamedIndividual.dc:source: Assessing Agricultural Consumptive Use in the Upper Colorado River Basin
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Community Collaborative Rain, Hail and Snow Network (CoCoRaHS)
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: Managed by Colorado Climate Center at Colorado State University

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Consumptive Irrigation Requirement (CIR)
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The quantity of irrigation water expressed as a depth or volume per unit area, exclusive of effective rainfall, that is consumptively used by plants or is evaporated from the soil surface in a specific period of time. It does not include water requirements for leaching, frost protection, wind erosion protection, or plant cooling. Such requirements are accounted for in on-farm efficiency values. The consumptive irrigation requirement may be numerically determined by subtracting effective rainfall from the consumptive use.
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: CIR is computed using the Blaney-Criddle Computer Program (BCCP) developed by NMOSE staff (Wilson, 1990).

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:isDefinedBy: The modified Blaney-Criddle crop coefficients are available from graphs in the SCS TR-21 publication for 25 crops, which were developed based on general climatic conditions representative of the Western U.S.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Crop Growth State Coefficient (Kc)
Delivery: Desalinated Water-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Delivery of desalinated sea water to the region's urban water system where no prior claim has been recognised on behalf of the urban water system

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Delivery: Inter-region-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Delivery of imported water to the region's surface water to service a prior claim recognised on behalf of the surface water. The prior claim may be an inter-basin agreement or an announced allocation held on a water resource located outside the region, but excludes water trade.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Delivery: Inter-region Agreement-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Delivery of imported water to the region's surface water to service a prior claim recognised on behalf of the surface water. The prior claim may be an inter-basin agreement or an announced allocation held on a water resource located outside the region, but excludes water trade.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Delivery: Irrigation Scheme-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Water transferred out of the region or delivered to users from the irrigation scheme

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Discharge: Groundwater-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Groundwater discharge to the region's surface water.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Discharge: Landscape-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Discharge from the groundwater or urban water system to the landscape, including soil, unconnected lakes and wetlands. It includes capillary rise and evaporation from the water table aquifer.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Discharge: Sea-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Stormwater that discharges directly into the sea via a stormwater outflow drain located on the coastline.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Discharge: Surface Water-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Discharge of groundwater from the saturated zone or water from the urban system to streams, water storages, farm dams and natural surface water features.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Discharge: Urban Supply-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Discharge from urban water systems to the region's surface water. It includes discharge of non-potable, potable, treated wastewater and recycled water. It includes pump back or transfer back of water to surface water for the purpose of storage and releases to meet environmental requirements. It excludes pump back or transfer of water to off-channel water storages considered part of the urban water system

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Discharge: Urban Supply System-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Discharge from urban water systems to the region's surface water. It includes discharge of non-potable, potable, treated wastewater and recycled water. It includes pump back or transfer back of water to surface water for the purpose of storage and releases to meet environmental requirements. It excludes pump back or transfer of water to off-channel water storages considered part of the urban water system

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Discharge: Wastewater-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Discharge of treated wastewater into the region. This definition includes discharge to sea and to other regions

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Diversions: Statutory Rights-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water diverted under statutory rights

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Extraction: Statutory Rights-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Groundwater extracted under statutory rights

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Industrial: Coalbed Methand Production-WY
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Monthly coalbed methane gas production and produced water data were downloaded from the WYOGCC data portal31. The WYOGCC compiles and publishes coalbed methane gas production according to the surface waterbody that receives produced water.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Industrial: Electrical Generation-WY
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Electrical generation is a major industrial water user in the Green, Northeast, and Platte River planning basins.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Industrial: Mine Production-WY
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Annual employee hours and coal production data were downloaded from the Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) web portal27. The MSHA is part of the United States Department of Labor.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Industrial: Miscellaneous-WY
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: USCB population data were used to index miscellaneous and road and bridge construction and maintenance industrial uses.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Industrial: Natural Gas-WY
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Natural gas processing is an industrial process to remove impurities from raw natural gas to create pipeline quality dry natural gas. Only the Bear River Basin accounted specifically consumptive water use at these facilities.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Industrial: Oil and Gas-WY
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Annual employee hours and coal production data were downloaded from the Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) web portal27. The MSHA is part of the United States Department of Labor.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Inter-region Inflow: Groundwater-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Groundwater transferred into the region from an external region

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Inter-region Inflow: Surface Water-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water transferred into the region from an external region

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Inter-region Outflow: Groundwater-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Groundwater transferred out of the region to an external region

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Irrigation Water Supply Limited Consumptive Use (Depletions)-WY
Leakage: Groundwater-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Leakage from urban system or surface water to the groundwater. It excludes pipe bursts, overflows or spills, which are classified as leakage to landscape.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Leakage: Landscape-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Leakage from the surface water or irrigation scheme to the unsaturated zone of the soil profile and which does not infiltrate to groundwater as recharge

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Leakage: Urban System-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Leakage from urban water systems to the region's groundwater. It includes exfiltration from wastewater collection systems. It includes leakage from non-potable, potable and recycled water supply systems. It excludes pipe bursts, overflows or spills.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Managed Aquifer Recharge: Individual User-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Managed aquifer recharge other than from the urban water system to the region's groundwater. It includes stormwater and industrial wastewater used for managed aquifer recharge and for a managed aquifer recharge scheme

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Midwest Plan Service Structures and Environmental Handbook, 1977
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:note: Source: CU and Losses Report 2001-2005 (Word Doc)

owl:NamedIndividual.dc:description: Before opening any mining operation, the operator must register the mine, mill, smelter, or pit with the Mining and Minerals Division of the New Mexico Energy, Minerals, and Natural Resources Department. A directory of all of the mining facilities registered in the state is updated annually.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Mining: Reported-NMOSE
Mining: Unreported-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Before opening any mining operation, the operator must register the mine, mill, smelter, or pit with the Mining and Minerals Division of the New Mexico Energy, Minerals, and Natural Resources Department. A directory of all of the mining facilities registered in the state is updated annually. This directory is used to identify the mines and mills that are not required to report their annual water withdrawals directly to the NMOSE. Those operations are then contacted by mail or phone to obtain withdrawal data.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Monthly Consumptive Use Coefficient (k)
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: k = (kt)(kc). The climatic coefficient (kt) equals 0.0173t-0.314, and kc is the crop growth stage coefficient.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Monthly Oil, Gas, and Produced Water

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:isDefinedBy: based on latitude of the area under study
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Monthly Percentage of Annual Daylight Hours (P)
NMOSE’s Water Use and Conservation Bureau (WUCB) Survey
NM Office of the State Engineer (NMOSE)
National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) Cropland Data Layer
National Climatic Data Center's Climatography of the United States No. 81
Non-Allocated Extraction: Individual Users-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Extraction from the region's groundwater by individual users where no prior claim has been recognised for individual use

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Non-allocated Diversion: Environmental Purposes-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water diverted without a recognised commitment to deliver surface water for environmental purposes.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Non-allocated Diversion: Individual Users-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water diverted to users other than the urban water system, under water access entitlements for which no allocation has been recognised (see line item 32.2 Surface water access entitlement for direct diversion). It includes non-allocated diversions for: • private users and irrigation schemes where those are not identified as a water asset of the water accounting region • allocation holders located outside the region's boundary. It excludes non-allocated diversions for: • irrigation schemes where those are identified as a water asset of the water accounting region

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Non-allocated Diversion: Urban System-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Surface water diverted to an urban water system, under water access entitlements for which no allocation has been recognised. It includes non-allocated diversions for: • allocation holders located outside the region's boundary.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Point Return: Irrigation-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Point discharge from irrigation scheme to the region's surface water. It includes overflows from irrigation scheme water supply channels and discharge of used irrigation water from irrigation scheme collection systems

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Power: Unreported-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The New Mexico Public Regulation Commission maintains a directory of all power-generating facilities in the state. This directory is used to identify electric utility companies that are not required to report their annual withdrawals directly to NMOSE. As with other non-reporting entities, these facilities are contacted by mail and/or phone to obtain withdrawal data.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Public Water Supply: Unmetered-NMOSE
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: For entities for which data were unavailable, information was either taken from NMED’s Water & Sewer Rate Surveys, or estimated based on population and the appropriate GPCD value for the Self-Supplied Domestic category.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Recharge: Groundwater-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Recharge from surface water to the region's groundwater. It includes the deliberate recharge of groundwater from surface water storages and rivers

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Recharge: Landscape-AUS
Recharge:Landscape-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Diffuse recharge from landscape to the region's groundwater due to both natural and artificial processes. It includes irrigation induced recharge. It excludes urban infiltration basin recharge or managed aquifer recharge

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Recharge: Surface Water-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Recharge from surface water to the region's groundwater. It includes the deliberate recharge of groundwater from surface water storages and rivers.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Recycled Water Delivery: Urban Users-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Delivery of recycled water from the region's urban water system to urban users for residential, commercial, industrial, municipal and individual irrigation use. It excludes delivery of water to the region's irrigation schemes where those are part of the w

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Remote Automated Weather Stations (RAWS)
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Managed by several Federal entities including the U.S. Bureau of Land Management and the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service. These stations are located in remote areas to assist in assessing wild fire vulnerability. The hourly climate data information from these climate stations is available online from the RAWS website, generally beginning in the mid-1990s

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Return Flow: Environmental Purposes-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The volume of returns of water from delivery service providers or water users to surface water assets for environmental use.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Sum of Monthly Consumptive Use Factors for Growing Season (F)
Supply System Delivery: Inter-Region-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Delivery of physical water to the region's urban water system through the supply system.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Supply System Delivery: Urban Users-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Delivery of water from the region's urban water system to urban users. It includes non-potable, potable and recycled water supplied from the region's urban water system for residential, commercial, industrial, municipal and individual irrigation use. It e

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Supply System Discharge: Reservoirs-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Discharge from the supply system to the regions reservoirs.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Supply System Transfer: Inter-region-AUS
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: Water transferred out of the region from the urban water system through the supply system

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: US Census Bureau "City and Town (Incorporated Places and Minor Civil Divisions)" data set
USDA Cropland Data Layer (CDL)
owl:NamedIndividual.skos:definition: The CDL is a georeferenced crop-specific land cover classification product with a 30 meter resolution that is produced annually. GIS was used to integrate the CDL crop types with a layer of potentially irrigated polygons covering the entire state.
